intro: Teucrium villosum, commonly known as velvet germander, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of blue to purple, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in rocky or dry habitats. Teucrium villosum is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat ailments such as digestive issues and skin conditions.
